title: Chaos, Entanglement and Measurement: Field-Theoretic Perspectives on Quantum Information Dynamics
summary: This work develops tools to understand how quantum information spreads, scrambles, and is reshaped by measurements in many-body systems. First, I study scrambling and pseudorandomness in the Brownian Sachdev-Ye-Kitaev (SYK) model, quantifying pseudorandomness using unitary k-designs and frame potentials.
